author: vikings
title: Cho Chang
review:
Box/Instructions:

Comes in normal CMS bag with normal CMS instructions. 

Parts:

Besides minifigure parts you get a dark tan (almost peanut butter) color owl with a tan belly with dark tan spots. The owl is really great to get. You also get the CMS 2x4 black stand. Overall decent piece haul for a CMS figure. 

Minifigure: 

Cho Chang:

Cho Chang is a nice figure to get. She has a black rubber hair piece (which is a little difficult to remove at times). She has a single sided head with a smile on it. She has printing on both sides of her torso. On the front you have the collar of her shirt with a tie in the colors of Ravenclaw (which is the house she is from). On the back you have a few markings showing the shirt but not much. She has a grey cloth piece for a skirt and black legs. She has a brown wand. 

Overall Opinion: 

Overall this is a nice figure from the Harry Potter wave. The new hair piece and cloth skirt are nice pieces to get. The owl is great and the colors work really well an is nice to get. I really like the Ravenclaw uniform and am really happy to get that printing on it. I do wish she had a double-sided head. Since it is a CMS figure it would have nice to have got it, but like so many in this series we have not. Overall I highly recommend this to any Harry Potter or CMS fan/collector. This figure will make a nice addition to anyones Lego collection. Overall I'm giving it a 4-star rating.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Harry's Maybe Could-Have-Been Girlfriend.
review:
Set #71022 Cho Chang: Cho includes some very nice ideas, but I am not a fan of her rubbery hair piece. It seems too soft for my liking, but the detailing matches up quite nicely with her classmates as far as print and accessories goes.

Cho features a printed sweater with a Ravenclaw tie visible at the neckline, she has a soft-goods cloth element which is easily misplaced/lost as one of the two Cho I got actually didn't come with the part (or I forgot it inside the foil pack when I tossed it.), she also has a mail owl in a lightish tan/brown and her wand.

Overall Cho is another solid offering, many of the Harry Potter series are and this is why I consistently rate them 4 out of 5, but nothing has truly captivated me yet. While I appreciate all the detailing and the accessories you have to truly wow me to hit that coveted 5 out of 5 rating. Still, Highly Recommended.
